channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA

item.title: Report E-2024090558
item.description:
Report E-2024090558

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When loading freight into trailer forklift operator was running the pallet of drums they were loading into the trailer and rubbed against the trailer wall and a rivet that was protruding sliced opened one of the drums consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the compromised container.

item.title: Report E-2024090521
item.description:
Report E-2024090521

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 19, 2024, at 1508 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania regarding the release of Clean Pro Isopropyl Alcohol (UN1219, 3, II). Terminal personnel reported that a total of 1 gallon was released from (2) 5-gallon metal pails that were dropped by a broken skid while being moved. Terminal personnel cleaned the release with absorbents and generated (2) 5-gallon DFs of waste that was then staged onsite pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090461
item.description:
Report E-2024090461

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 23:54 EST on 8/29, XPO-XHG contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 gallon of UN1866 "PUMADEQ FLEX 31MV - WHITE" from a 2.5gal poly pail. A nail in the pallet punctured the pail. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE. The damaged poly drum and clean up debris were containerized into a 20-gallon poly drum, which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024091196
item.description:
Report X-2024091196

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: EAST PETERSBURG
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING IN BLUE PICKOFF, AND WAS REMOVED FROM PICKOFF ONTO CATWALK GRATE. A RESPONDER WAS SUMMONED TO RECOVER PACKAGE AND ABSORB SPILLED CONTENTS WITH WIPE-ALLS AND ZEP ZORBENT.
